TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi beforefieldinit TaskDialogPage extends System.Object

Docs.summary: Represents a page of content of a task dialog.

remarks.format:
## Remarks
It is possible to navigate a task dialog while it is shown by invoking the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.TaskDialogPage.Navigate(System.Windows.Forms.TaskDialogPage)> method with a target <xref:System.Windows.Forms.TaskDialogPage> instance.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig specialname rtspecialname instance void .ctor() cil managed

Docs.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.

MemberSignature.Value: public: property bool AllowCancel { bool get(); void set(bool value); };
member this.AllowCancel : bool with get, set

Docs.summary: Gets or sets a value that indicates whether the task dialog can be closed with as resulting button by pressing ESC or Alt+F4 or by clicking the title bar's close button, even if a button isn't added to the collection.
Docs.value: to allow to close the dialog by pressing ESC or Alt+F4 or by clicking the title bar's close button; otherwise, . The default value is .

remarks.format:
## Remarks
You can intercept cancellation of the dialog without displaying a "Cancel" button by adding the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.TaskDialogButton.Cancel> button that has its <xref:System.Windows.Forms.TaskDialogButton.Visible> property set to `false`.

Docs.exception: The property is set and this page instance is currently bound to a task dialog.

MemberSignature.Value: public: property bool AllowMinimize { bool get(); void set(bool value); };
member this.AllowMinimize : bool with get, set

Docs.summary: Gets or sets a value that indicates whether the task dialog can be minimized when it is shown modeless.
Docs.value: to specify that the task dialog can be minimized; otherwise, . The default value is .

remarks.format:
## Remarks
When setting this property to `true`, <xref:System.Windows.Forms.TaskDialogPage.AllowCancel> is automatically implied.

Docs.exception: The property is set and this page instance is currently bound to a task dialog.

MemberSignature.Value: public: property System::Windows::Forms::TaskDialog ^ BoundDialog { System::Windows::Forms::TaskDialog ^ get(); };
Public ReadOnly Property BoundDialog As TaskDialog

Docs.summary: Gets the instance which this page is currently bound to.
Docs.value: The instance which this page is bound to, or if this page is not currently bound.

remarks.format:
## Remarks
A page will be bound while it is being displayed, which is indicated by the events <xref:System.Windows.Forms.TaskDialogPage.Created> and <xref:System.Windows.Forms.TaskDialogPage.Destroyed>.
While a page is bound to a task dialog, you cannot show that page instance using a different <xref:System.Windows.Forms.TaskDialog> instance at the same time.

MemberSignature.Value: public: property System::Windows::Forms::TaskDialogButtonCollection ^ Buttons { System::Windows::Forms::TaskDialogButtonCollection ^ get(); void set(System::Windows::Forms::TaskDialogButtonCollection ^ value); };

Docs.summary: Gets or sets the collection of push buttons to be shown in this page.
Docs.value: The collection of custom buttons to be shown in this page.
Docs.exception: The property is set and this page instance is currently bound to a task dialog.

MemberSignature.Value: public: property System::String ^ Caption { System::String ^ get(); void set(System::String ^ value); };
member this.Caption : string with get, set

Docs.summary: Gets or sets the text to display in the title bar of the task dialog.

remarks.format:
## Remarks
This property can be set while the dialog is shown.

Docs.exception: The property is set and the task dialog has started navigating to this page instance, but the event has not been raised yet. - or - The property is set on a page instance that is currently bound to a task dialog, but the dialog has just started navigating to a different page.

Docs.summary: Occurs after this instance is bound to a task dialog and the task dialog has created the GUI elements represented by this instance.

remarks.format:
## Remarks
This will happen after showing or navigating the dialog.
When this event occurs, the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.TaskDialogPage.BoundDialog> property will return the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.TaskDialog> instance which this page is bound to.

MemberSignature.Value: public: property System::Windows::Forms::TaskDialogButton ^ DefaultButton { System::Windows::Forms::TaskDialogButton ^ get(); void set(System::Windows::Forms::TaskDialogButton ^ value); };
member this.DefaultButton : System.Windows.Forms.TaskDialogButton with get, set

Docs.summary: Gets or sets the default button in the task dialog.
Docs.value: The default button in the task dialog.

Docs.summary: Occurs when the task dialog is about to destroy the GUI elements represented by this instance and it is about to be unbound from the task dialog.

remarks.format:
## Remarks
This will happen when closing or navigating the dialog.
After this event occurs, the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.TaskDialogPage.BoundDialog> property will return `null`.

MemberSignature.Value: public: property System::Windows::Forms::TaskDialogExpander ^ Expander { System::Windows::Forms::TaskDialogExpander ^ get(); void set(System::Windows::Forms::TaskDialogExpander ^ value); };
member this.Expander : System.Windows.Forms.TaskDialogExpander with get, set

Docs.summary: Gets or sets the dialog expander to be shown in this page.

remarks.format:
## Remarks
The expander button (and the expanded area) will only be shown if its <xref:System.Windows.Forms.TaskDialogExpander.Text> property is not `null` or an empty string.

Docs.exception: The property is set and this page instance is currently bound to a task dialog.

MemberSignature.Value: public: property System::Windows::Forms::TaskDialogFootnote ^ Footnote { System::Windows::Forms::TaskDialogFootnote ^ get(); void set(System::Windows::Forms::TaskDialogFootnote ^ value); };
member this.Footnote : System.Windows.Forms.TaskDialogFootnote with get, set

Docs.summary: Gets or sets the footnote to be shown in this page.

remarks.format:
## Remarks
The footnote will only be shown if its <xref:System.Windows.Forms.TaskDialogFootnote.Text> property is not `null` or an empty string.

Docs.exception: The property is set and this page instance is currently bound to a task dialog.

MemberSignature.Value: public: property System::String ^ Heading { System::String ^ get(); void set(System::String ^ value); };
member this.Heading : string with get, set

Docs.summary: Gets or sets the heading (main instruction).

remarks.format:
## Remarks
This property can be set while the dialog is shown.

Docs.exception: The property is set on a page instance that is currently bound to a task dialog, but the dialog has just started navigating to a different page.

Docs.summary: Occurs when the user presses F1 while the task dialog has focus, or when the user clicks the button.

MemberSignature.Value: public: property System::Windows::Forms::TaskDialogIcon ^ Icon { System::Windows::Forms::TaskDialogIcon ^ get(); void set(System::Windows::Forms::TaskDialogIcon ^ value); };
member this.Icon : System.Windows.Forms.TaskDialogIcon with get, set

Docs.summary: Gets or sets the main icon.

remarks.format:
## Remarks
This property can be set while the dialog is shown, however, it cannot be switched between instances created from an <xref:System.Drawing.Icon> (or from a handle pointer) and standard icon instances.

Docs.exception: The property is set and the task dialog has started navigating to this page instance, but the event has not been raised yet. - or - The property is set on a page instance that is currently bound to a task dialog, but the dialog has just started navigating to a different page.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig instance void Navigate(class System.Windows.Forms.TaskDialogPage page) cil managed

Docs.param: The page instance that contains the contents which this task dialog will display.
Docs.summary: Shows the new content in the current task dialog. .

remarks.format:
## Remarks
During the navigation the dialog will recreate the dialog from the specified `page` and its controls, and unbind and destroy the currently shown page.
You can't manipulate the page or its controls immediately after navigating the dialog (except for calling <xref:System.Windows.Forms.TaskDialog.Close> or navigating the dialog again). You will need to wait for the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.TaskDialogPage.Created> event to occur before you can manipulate the page or its controls.

Docs.exception: The page instance is not currently bound to a dialog, is . - or - This page instance contains an invalid configuration. - or - This method is called from within the event of one of the radio buttons of the current task dialog. - or - The task dialog has already been closed.

MemberSignature.Value: public: property System::Windows::Forms::TaskDialogProgressBar ^ ProgressBar { System::Windows::Forms::TaskDialogProgressBar ^ get(); void set(System::Windows::Forms::TaskDialogProgressBar ^ value); };

Docs.summary: Gets or sets the progress bar to be shown in this page.

remarks.format:
## Remarks
The progress bar will only be shown if its <xref:System.Windows.Forms.TaskDialogProgressBar.State> property is not <xref:System.Windows.Forms.TaskDialogProgressBarState.None>.

Docs.exception: The property is set and this page instance is currently bound to a task dialog.

Docs.summary: Gets or sets the collection of radio buttons to be shown in this page.
Docs.value: The collection of radio buttons to be shown in this page.
Docs.exception: The property is set and this page instance is currently bound to a task dialog.

MemberSignature.Value: public: property bool RightToLeftLayout { bool get(); void set(bool value); };
member this.RightToLeftLayout : bool with get, set

Docs.summary: Gets or sets a value that indicates whether text and controls are displayed reading right to left.
Docs.value: to display text and controls reading right to left; to display controls reading left to right. The default value is .

remarks.format:
## Remarks
Note that once a task dialog has been opened with or has navigated to a <xref:System.Windows.Forms.TaskDialogPage> where this flag is set, it will keep on subsequent navigations to a new <xref:System.Windows.Forms.TaskDialogPage> even when it doesn't have this flag set.

Docs.exception: The property is set and this page instance is currently bound to a task dialog.

MemberSignature.Value: public: property bool SizeToContent { bool get(); void set(bool value); };
member this.SizeToContent : bool with get, set

Docs.summary: Indicates that the width of the task dialog is determined by the width of its content area (similar to Message Box sizing behavior).
Docs.value: to determine the width of the task dialog by the width of its content area; otherwise, . The default value is .
Docs.exception: The property is set and this page instance is currently bound to a task dialog.

member this.Text : string with get, set

Docs.summary: Gets or sets the dialog's primary text content.

remarks.format:
## Remarks
This property can be set while the dialog is shown.

Docs.exception: The property is set on a page instance that is currently bound to a task dialog, but the dialog has just started navigating to a different page.

remarks.format:
## Remarks
The verification checkbox will only be shown if its <xref:System.Windows.Forms.TaskDialogVerificationCheckBox.Text> property is not `null` or an empty string.

Docs.exception: The property is set and this page instance is currently bound to a task dialog.
